title: MSL/RAD Level 2 observational radiation data - D. Hassler (SwRI-Boulder)

info.x_cadence_note: Cadence based on variable 'EPOCH' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/msl/rad/cdf/obs-l2/2015/msl_rad_obs-l2_2015001_v00.cdf. This most common cadence occurred for 43.0233% of the 37 timesteps. Cadence = 1021000000000 [ns] = PT1021S.

parameters.name: ALIVE_TIME_f
parameters.description: [Quality filtered] Actual instrument observation time. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_filter_flag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['ALIVE_TIME', 'FLAGGED_DATA']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: DOSIMETRY_TOTAL_f
parameters.description: [Quality filtered] Radiation dose rate on Mars (recorded in Si, corrected for MMRTG contribution, and tissue-equivalent plastic). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_filter_flag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['DOSIMETRY_TOTAL', 'FLAGGED_DATA']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Total Dose for B both total, and corrected for RTG background

parameters.name: DOSIMETRY_TIMESLICE_f
parameters.description: [Quality filtered] Total Dose for an observation at 1/16th timeslice of an observation. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_filter_flag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['DOSIMETRY_TIMESLICE', 'FLAGGED_DATA']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Total Dose for B and E in 1/16th time increments of an observation

parameters.name: LET_A1A2_f
parameters.description: [Quality filtered] LET spectrum on Mars in Si (geometric factor ~ 0.9 cm^2 sr). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_filter_flag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['LET_A1A2', 'FLAGGED_DATA']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_DE_f
parameters.description: [Quality filtered] Neutral particle (neutrons + gamma rays) counts on Mars. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_filter_flag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_DE', 'FLAGGED_DATA']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_D_f
parameters.description: [Quality filtered] Neutral particle counts in CsI. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_filter_flag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_D', 'FLAGGED_DATA']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_E_f
parameters.description: [Quality filtered] Neutral particle counts in tissue-equivalent plastic. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function apply_filter_flag (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_E', 'FLAGGED_DATA']. Note that not all COMPONENTS are time series and so their values are not available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: DOSIMETRY_TOTAL
parameters.description: [All quality] Radiation dose rate on Mars (recorded in Si, corrected for MMRTG contribution, and tissue-equivalent plastic)
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Total Dose for B both total, and corrected for RTG background

parameters.name: DOSIMETRY_TIMESLICE
parameters.description: [All quality] Total Dose for an observation at 1/16th timeslice of an observation
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Total Dose for B and E in 1/16th time increments of an observation

parameters.name: LET_A1A2
parameters.description: [All quality] LET spectrum on Mars in Si (geometric factor ~ 0.9 cm^2 sr)

parameters.name: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_DE
parameters.description: [All quality] Neutral particle (neutrons + gamma rays) counts on Mars

parameters.name: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_D
parameters.description: [All quality] Neutral particle counts in CsI

parameters.name: HISTOGRAM_NEUTRAL_E
parameters.description: [All quality] Neutral particle counts in tissue-equivalent plastic

parameters.name: FLAGGED_DATA
parameters.description: [NO PLOT] Quality indicator - flagged data has quality issues from various sources, Commanding, DAN activity, Other; no value=good
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: Flagged data should be removed for science
